definitions.text: the quotient obtained when the magnitude of a part is divided by the magnitude of the whole
balance among the parts of something
the relation between things (or parts of things) with respect to their comparative quantity, magnitude, or degree
examples: an inordinate proportion of the book is given over to quotations
a dry martini has a large proportion of gin

definitions.text: harmonious arrangement or relation of parts or elements within a whole (as in a design); - John Ruskin
examples: in all perfectly beautiful objects there is found the opposition of one part to another and a reciprocal balance
harmonize a building with those surrounding it

definitions.text: adjust in size relative to other things
